body: @svarnau , please help to verify this patch. Thanks.
Thanks Selva. Will close the current PR and reopen another one.

I think this flag does change the histogram. There is another variable that contains the selectivity for Like, whose value seems to be determined by the length the of the prefix. However this flag may be used to to pass along the value in the selectivity variable. I am not certain that selectivity computation is affected in simple LIKE expanisin of the form addressed in this fix.

I do not think this partcular issue is due the selectivity of Like being different from that of the pair of range predicates. Before making this change I tried passing various selectivity values for the LIKE predicate using a hint. None had the desired effect.

During debugging we can see that from MDAM costing we call applyPred (with another colStat method in between costing code and applyPred). In applyPred the derivativeOfLike  setting causes us to  estimate that the like predicate is going require most of the table to be scanned.

My reasoning is that if we give a pair of range predicates instead of LIKE, we get the desired plan. I can see that for complex forms of like (with leading wildcard, or underscore matching) we may need  a specialized estimating techinique. But for a simple LIKE with a trailing wildcard, no special estimation logic is required. It should be handled the same as a pair of bounding range predicates.

I understood from @arvind-narain that this PR is not changing the package name of T4 driver and it just changes the group id in maven.  I misunderstood the change earlier. If this is what is expected in the PR, then the change looks good.
Another option to optimize this code is to replace strlen with sizeof(HIVE_DEFAULT_NULL_STRING)
@selvaganesang, so is this ready to be merged?
@zellerh, @selvaganesang: Is this change ready to merge?
It looks good to me, but I have only limited knowledge about JDBC.
@zellerh Can you please review this PR at least the memory monitor counters related changes
Any other comments ? If not I think  it's ready to merge

The second commit consists of changes in config files because there were errors reported in monitor logs about the process inability to open the rootLogger appender, but the process would come up. When I properly configured the rootLogger appender like another RollingLogAppender or ConsoleAppender, initLog4cxx fails while opening the appender. So, I added just the rootLogger without any appender. This seems to work without having duplicate messages in the log file. The additivity flag in the appender didn't work as expected because the same appender is used for both rootLogger and the  child logger.

Removing the rootLogger configuration also worked

Can you please consider retrying hbcheck few time with delay in between before exiting from sqstart?  The developer needs to issue sqstart repeatedly to start Trafodion if it brings down hbase and restarts.
Pinging again, @selvaganesang, is this ready to be merged?

@selvaganesang, interesting, I thought the arguments "4 30" provided caused 4 retries, but looking at the code it seems like hbcheck is ignoring these arguments. The java program does set hbase.client.retries.number to 3, however, and it does some retries. I tested this by running "sqstart" and then starting HBase a few seconds later, and hbcheck did wait long enough for the "sqstart" command to succeed.
@arvind-narain Thanks for your input.  Please review this PR
In the absence of further comments from @andyyangcn I will merge this PR.

Thanks Selva for this change and for taking care of the SQL.HBASE error in monitor logs. 

Would the following also need to be touched ? dbsecurity/auth/src/authEvents.cpp ? logging in the dbsecurity library was implemented by @robertamarton.

+1 for this change.

One other comment (last one :) ) - any script that expects master_exec logs in the logs directory ( like sqtools.sh) will need to be modified to pick up the new log file name.
Thanks Arvind. I didn't change the security logging because the security logging might have different kind of requirements. I will let @robertamarton  to manage it after this change is merged.

It looks like the messages are seen in your 2nd comment are seen in the log because the log level for  SQL.Hbase category is changed to INFO.  Can you please file JIRAs so that it can be picked up the relevant contributors.
+1 Thanks Selva for handling the extra error messages in the logs and sqtools.sh
